p: In addition, while previous work shows that climate change stressors can have a number of effects on escape performance and therefore on prey vulnerability, further important effects of climate change (e.g. warming) may impact other aspects of swimming (e.g. aerobic swimming), which can trade off with anaerobic swimming ( Reidy et al., 2000 ), (but see Marras et al., 2013 ), with potential consequences of sustained activity such as that used for migration. Therefore, the overall ecological effects of climate change on organisms need to take into account many interacting levels of physiological impacts that may result in a number of trade-offs.
